intro: Cyrtandra molokaiensis, commonly known as the Moloka'i Cyrtandra, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian island of Moloka'i. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded habitats such as forest understories and rocky areas. It has simple, opposite leaves and produces small, fleshy fruits that contain seeds. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
